newsitem.title: USA: American Mobile stake lifted by Baron.
newsitem.headline: American Mobile stake lifted by Baron.

text.p: New York investor Ronald Baron said Thursday he had raised his stake in American Mobile Satellite Corp to 19.6 percent, or 5,883,233 shares, from 18.3 percent.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Baron said his latest transactions included the purchase of 378,400 shares betweeen February 21 and March 4 at prices ranging from $11.9024 to $13.375 each.
Based in Reston, Va., American Mobile operates North America's first high-powered satellite-based mobile communications systems.
Baron is president of Baron Capital Management Inc, BAMCO Inc and Baron Capital Inc, all based in New York.
